title: Please nerf Hexdrinker in some way so that people actually build Maw
body: I play so many games where multiple players will build Hexdrinker and then never finish upgrading it into Maw because of how strong Hexdrinker's passive is. People treat Hex like it is a full build item when it is not, and I would argue that Hexdrinker is probably the best mid-build item in the whole game. I'm not looking for this item to be gutted, but I don't think it should be so good that players aren't willing to finish upgrading it into Maw.

By itself Hexdrinker will block at least 270 magic damage at level 6.

That alone is enough to completely tank Orianna's ult and not break the shield.
It will also block most if not all of Karthus' ult.
Ekko's will also get completely tanked.
Ziggs will maybe get 10-20% of the damage through if he centers on the target.
Syndra will get about 10-50% of the damage through depending on the number of spheres.

Define "block."  Hexdrinker has a 160 shield at level 6.

I guess it may be too hard to understand that shields scale with resistances. In this case with MR.

The lowest possible MR is 65 (30 base + 35 item). That equals to 0.606 damage taken.
160/0.606=270 aka the effective value of the Hexdrinker's shield at level 6.

If you're going to account resistances in that shield value, then you also need to account for the ap scaling of the champion in question **and** their magic penetration. A 160 shield with 35 MR is unlikely to tank an Orianna ult, which is still one of the least damaging AP nuke abilities in the game. Syndra's ult for example (when optimally executed) has 450 base damage + 100% scaling. Ori has 170 base damage and 70% scaling with her ult, but a lot of cc with it.

Ori is not a nuke champion. She never has been. She can get ahead and nuke people but so can *any* mage, she's more about utility and aoe cc/damage instead of bursting a priority target. But **even Ori** can break the shield with her ult, as the damage that hexdrinker blocks is around 200, and she does well over 200 at lvl 6+ because of AP scaling.

If we are going technical, then fine.

At level 6 Orianna without Sorcs against a target with no bonus MR except Hexdrinker will need 157 AP to break the shield with the ult.

As for Hexdrinker's strength, at level 6, taking into the account the base MR, item MR, Ori's runes and masteries, the shield has 260 EHP.

You REALLY want me to go full math on you? Fine.

Two things to note before we start:
1. Your math is **completely** wrong.
2. Even as a proof of concept I can't really see how you can get Sorcs and **at least** NLR-worth of additional AP at level 6 with a maximum of 2000 gold, but let's roll with it.

---

**At level 6:**

Ori's ult damage = 150 + 0.7 AP
M.pen from runes = 2.6
M.pen from masteries = 3 _(it got nerfed btw, I forgot about that in my previous post)_
M.pen from items = 15
Total m.pen = 20.6
Enemy base MR = 30 + 3 (lowest possible)
Enemy item MR = 35
Enemy total MR = 68
Enemy MR after penetration = 47.4 (Let's call it "EMR" or "Effective MR")
Hexdrinker's shield value = 160

---

**Equations:**

1. http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb1501588172/leagueoflegends/images/math/9/a/d/9ade83548a9d4792ddc6ef6e5da61a22.png
A simplified formula for a single damage type:
EHP = HP * (1 + 0.01 x EMR)

2. AP required to deal damage equal to EHP _(Let's call it "EAP" or "Effective AP needed")_
 EAP = ( EHP - Ult base damage ) / Ult AP ratio

---

1. .
Shield EHP = 160 x ( 1 + 0.01 x 47.4 ) = 160 x 1.474
Shield EHP = 235.84 HP

2. .
EAP = ( 235.8 - 150 ) / 0.7
EAP = 122.57 AP

---

**Results:**

1. Hexdrinker has 236 Effective HP.
2. Orianna needs 123 AP to break the shield.

---

**Bonus for lack of Sorcs**, because pretty much nobody ever buys Sorcs at level 6:

EHP = 160 x ( 1 + 0.01 * 62.4)
EHP = 259.84 HP

EAP = ( 259.84 - 150 ) / 0.7
EAP = 156.9 AP

---

**TL;DR**

Orianna will never be able to break Hexdrinker's shield at level 6 with her ult.

There is nothing to argue about here.

GA restores up to 50% of health, meaning you must receive up to 150% damage to actually die.
Zhonya leaves you at the same exact spot.

Not to mention you actually need to hit the active to Zhonya's, meaning that it's up to the player to dodge the burst / make sure their positioning is correct when they use it. 

By contrast, GA always activates as soon as you die. This means you can't waste it by pressing it early, or forget to use it. It always activates at the most efficient time possible.
